p:
The model estimates of annual number of new diagnoses and prevalent diagnosed cases were similar to the reported numbers for the respective years in 1984–2012, except for a modest underestimation of the newly diagnosed male in 2002–2008, and slight underestimation of the prevalent diagnosed cases in 2013.(
Fig 1 ) In base-case scenario, HIV infections (including undiagnosed individuals) would increase by 37% (from 2555 in 2014 to 3503 in 2023), with male-to-female ratio falling slightly from 1.74:1 to 1.54:1. The total number of new infections would be 672 for male and 452 for female in 2012–2023. The profile of HIV infections, treatment uptake, retention in care and viral load suppression by 2023 is shown in
Table 2 .
